docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
This page highlights my academic qualifications, research work, publications and ongoing projects.

Thank you for visiting.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I am Renu Kumari, passionate about advancing knowledge in - Plant Biology - Biodiversity - Phytochemistry - Capacity building - Resource development and - Liberating knowledge from climate reports etc.

  • 🌍 Location: Delhi, India
  • 📧 Email: [kumarirenu18@gmail.com]
  • X: [@epiren20]
  • GitHub: rkclimate20
  • LinkedIn: Renu Kumari

docs.title: Ph.D.
docs.text:
• Institution: Under the guidance of Prof. Vinay Sharma, Banasthali University, Rajasthan and Prof. Sushil Kumar, BRIC-National Institute of Plant Genome Research (NIPGR), New Delhi
  • Year: 2013
  • Title of the thesis: Characterization of salinity tolerant morphological mutants in the medicinal-cum-ornamental plant Catharanthus roseus.
  • Subject: Biotechnology

docs.title: B.Sc.
docs.text:
• Institution: Jiwaji University, Gwalior, M.P.
  • Year: 2005
  • Subject: Botany, Zoology and Chemistry

docs.title: Project Scientist III
docs.text:
• Organization: BRIC-National Institute of Plant Genome Research, Aruna Asaf Ali Marg, New Delhi-110067
  • Year of joining: 2023
  • Responsibilities:
  • Maintainer and developer of the “SWATI” portal (a Compendium of Indian Women in Science), a National platform highlighting contributions of women scientists in India
  • Maintainer of #semanticClimate website and creating resources for climate knowledge
  • Internship program coordinator with #semantiCcClimate, organizing outreach (workshops and training), maintaining GitHub project of #semanticClimate and making climate knowledge accessible to all through semantic toolkits.

docs.title: Skills
docs.text:
• Programming: Python
  • Web Development: HTML, CSS
  • Data Science: Pandas, NumPy
  • Other Tools: Git, graphviz
  • Program and project management
  • Semantic technologies and AI-based text analysis
  • Science communication and community engagement
  • Workshop organization
  • Internship coordination at #semanticClimate
  • GitHub project maintenance and open-source collaboration
